# Add eventlines to the chart

**\[experimental\]**

A high-level `plotly::layout()`-function. The function adds `shapes` and
`annotations` to the main
[`chart()`](https://serkor1.github.io/cryptoQuotes/reference/chart.md).

## Usage

``` r
add_event(data, ...)
```

## Arguments

- data:

  a [data.frame](https://rdrr.io/r/base/data.frame.html)-type object
  with `index`, `event` and `color` columns.

- ...:

  For internal use. Please ignore.

## Value

A
[`plotly::plot_ly()`](https://rdrr.io/pkg/plotly/man/plot_ly.html)-object
with `shapes` and `annotations`

## Details

The [data.frame](https://rdrr.io/r/base/data.frame.html) must include
the following columns,

- `index` [integer](https://rdrr.io/r/base/integer.html) or
  [date](https://rdrr.io/r/base/date.html): corresponding to the event
  timing.

- `event` [character](https://rdrr.io/r/base/character.html): the event
  label.

- `color` [character](https://rdrr.io/r/base/character.html): the color
  of the event

## Examples

``` r
# script start;

# 1) Generate random events
# of buys and sells and convert
# to data.frame
#
# Note: tibbles, data.tables are also supported
# but only base R is shown here to avoid
# too many dependencies
set.seed(1903)
event_data <- cryptoQuotes::ATOM[
  sample(
    x = 1:nrow(cryptoQuotes::ATOM),
    size = 2
  )
]

# 1.1) Extract the index
# from the event data
index <- zoo::index(
  event_data
)

# 1.2) Convert the coredata
# into a data.frame
event_data <- as.data.frame(
  zoo::coredata(
    event_data
  )
)

# 1.3) Add the index into the data.frame
# case insensitive
event_data$index <- index

# 1.4) add events to the data.
# here we use Buys and Sells.
event_data$event <- rep(
  x = c('Buy', 'Sell'),
  lenght.out = nrow(event_data)
)

# 1.5) add colors based
# on the event; here buy is colored
# darkgrey, and if the position is closed
# with profit the color is green
event_data$color <- ifelse(
  event_data$event == 'Buy',
  yes = 'darkgrey',
  no = ifelse(
    test = subset(
      x = event_data,
      event == 'Buy'
    )$close <
      subset(x = event_data, event == 'Sell')$close,
    yes = 'green',
    no = 'red'
  )
)

# 1.6) modify the event to add
# closing price at each event
event_data$event <- paste0(
  event_data$event,
  ' @',
  event_data$close
)

# 2) Chart the the klines
# and add the buy and sell events
cryptoQuotes::chart(
  ticker = cryptoQuotes::ATOM,
  main = cryptoQuotes::kline(),
  sub = list(
    cryptoQuotes::volume()
  ),
  indicator = list(
    cryptoQuotes::bollinger_bands()
  ),
  event_data = event_data,
  options = list(
    dark = TRUE,
    deficiency = FALSE
  )
)
```
